intro: Parosela lasiathera, commonly known as the rough-leaved parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically rough and hairy, giving it its common name. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
